qlearning.client

Class Action

  • java.lang.Object
    • qlearning.client.Action
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Down, Left, Right, Up

    public abstract class Action
extends Object
implements Runnable
    An act that can be performed that will lead to a change in the Environment's current State.

    The Agent assumes that taking gridworld.actions using run() somehow changes the state of the Environment. Calling execute() on Actions is the "output" of this system. This could drive motors, change an HVAC's set temperature, move a game piece, and so on. As long as this has a chance of changing what we get from Environment.getState(), then the system can learn to optimize its choices.

    Note: This class must implement hashCode() and equals(Object)! The system uses these comparisons to look up the quality values of State-Action pairs, so if two different Actions are seen as equivalent, then the system will not work correctly. For example, if you are moving a game piece on a board, make sure that "up" means the same "up" everywhere!

    You can use this class to wrap your own Runnable classes. If your Runnables spawn new threads, be careful of the QLearning system interacting with the Environment is thread-safe, lest your Runnable manipulates the Environment while the Agent is trying to get the next State from it.
